---
title: Decimal
slug: en/v2/api/data/decimal
---

import Badge from "~/components/en/Badge.astro";

`Decimal` is a class for representing arbitrary-precision real numbers. If the preset is `standard`, the class inherits from [`big.js`](https://github.com/MikeMcl/big.js). This may cause the results of methods like `.toString()` to differ between presets.

### Import

```ts
import { Decimal } from "@tai-kun/surrealdb/decodeonly-datatypes";
import { Decimal } from "@tai-kun/surrealdb/encodable-datatypes";
import { Decimal } from "@tai-kun/surrealdb/standard-datatypes";
```

### `.constructor()`

Creates a new `Decimal` object.

```ts
new Decimal(source: string); // decode-only, encodable
new Decimal(source: string | number | Decimal); // standard
```

#### Arguments

##### `source`

A string representation of the real number. If the preset is `standard`, a number can also be passed.

#### Returns

When called via `new`, `Decimal` returns its instance.

### `.toString()` <Badge variant="instance" /><Badge variant="method" /><Badge variant="decodeonly" />

Retrieves the real number as a string.

#### Arguments

None.

#### Returns

Returns a string representation of the real number.

### `.toSurql()` <Badge variant="instance" /><Badge variant="method" /><Badge variant="encodable" />

Converts the `Decimal` object to a string that can be embedded in SurrealQL. It is similar to `.toString()`, but it adds a `dec` suffix to inform the query parser that the string represents a `decimal` type.

```ts
.toSurql(): string;
```

#### Arguments

None.

#### Returns

Returns the real number with the `dec` suffix.

#### Example

```ts
import { Decimal } from "@tai-kun/surrealdb/encodable-datatypes";

const decimal = new Decimal("3.14");
console.log(decimal.toSurql());
//-> 3.14dec
```

### `.clone()` <Badge variant="instance" /><Badge variant="method" /><Badge variant="standard" />

Clones the `Decimal` object.

```ts
.clone(): this;
```

#### Arguments

None.

#### Returns

Returns a new `Decimal` object. If the `Decimal` class is inherited, an instance of that class is returned.

### Other Methods

If you are using the standard preset, the `Decimal` class inherits from the `Big` class in `big.js`. Therefore, the instance methods and properties can be found in the `big.js` documentation:

[`big.js` Documentation](https://mikemcl.github.io/big.js/#prototype-methods)

### Development

#### General Purpose Determination of `Decimal` Objects

It is recommended to use the `isDecimal` function to determine if a value is a `Decimal` object regardless of the preset. This function does not use `instanceof`, which is helpful when the preset of the value being checked is unknown.

```ts
import { isDecimal } from "@tai-kun/surrealdb";
```
